chargeHist.descr: Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order
Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) and OWI (7th, 8th or 9th). The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) and the other charge, OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Beau L. Stuhr was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Beau L. Stuhr was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Beau L. Stuhr

records.addlTxt: of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

3:17 PM Defendant Beau L. Stuhr in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew C. Allen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Andrew J. Burdick in court for Beau L. Stuhr.  Amended information filed.  Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant. Waiver of formal reading of the amended information.  Defendant stands mute - not guilty plea entered. State recites joint recommendation:  Ct 2: dismissed, but read-in.  Ct 3: dismissed.  Ct 1:  12 mo jail, concurrent with any other sentences.  Ct 4:  WSP 10 yrs:  5 yrs initial, 5 yrs extended, concurrent to any other sentences:  $2097 + $40.50 bdf + $20 cps; 36 mo DLR; 36 mo IID; AODA/dsp; counseling as recommended by DOC; absolute sobriety; random UAs/PBTs by DOC.  Eligible for both programs.  70 days credit.  Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant. Defendant sworn by the Clerk. Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form - colloquy given.  Defendant freely, willingly, knowledgeably and intelligently enters into the plea agreement and joint recommendation. Court accepts the joint recommendation and sentences the defendant accordingly.

10:06 AM Attorney Matthew C. Allen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Andrew J. Burdick appeared by video for Beau L. Stuhr.  Defendant unable to be transported today; request for reschedule.  DAs office to writ defendant from DCI.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on July 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Parties are still in negotiations but pleas is likely.  In re. PLEAS, defendant is unsure if he will request in person or zoom appearance.  Atty Burdick to advise the Court on 06/28/2022 on whether or not defendant will request in person appearance.
Status conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
